title: Las bajas que sufre Chivas tras su eliminaciÃ³n en Leagues Cup 2024
text:
Chivas no solo sufriÃ³ por su eliminaciÃ³n de la Leagues Cup 2024, el cuadro rojiblanco tambiÃ©n sufriÃ³ algunas bajas, ya que 3 jugadores resultaron lesionados, prendiendo las alarmas del equipo mientras se mantiene la pausa de la Liga MX.
Chivas no pudo sumar una victoria en la Leagues Cup , empatÃ³ sus dos partidos pero perdiÃ³ en los penales, y ya es el segundo aÃ±o consecutivo en el que no logra avanzar de Fase de Grupos.
El cuadro que dirige Fernando Gago regresÃ³ a MÃ©xico tras su eliminaciÃ³n, y suma un nuevo problema, las bajas que le dejÃ³ el torneo.

â€˜Caneloâ€™ Ãlvarez no duda que Marco Verde logre ganar el oro en ParÃ­s 2024
Los jugadores lesionados de Chivas El Guadalajara sufriÃ³ las lesiones de tres jugadores, Javier â€œEl Chicharitoâ€ HernÃ¡ndez, PÃ¡vel PÃ©rez y Roberto Alvarado , tres jugadores claves en la plantilla rojiblanca.
Pero Chivas no tiene solo 3 bajas, sino 5, ya que JesÃºs Chiquete Orozco y RaÃºl MartÃ­nez , no pudieron jugar en Leagues Cup debido a las lesiones que presentaron previo al inicio del torneo. Aunque no son lesiones de gravedad, el Guadalajara espera que sus jugadores se recuperen previo al inicio de la Liga MX.
Â¿CuÃ¡ndo regresa Chivas a la actividad? Las Chivas regresan a la actividad en el Apertura 2024 en la Jornada 5 que se disputarÃ¡ el prÃ³ximo 24 de agosto, cuando enfrenten a Tigres en el Estadio Universitario, en el que serÃ¡ el primer reencuentro con el que fue su tÃ©cnico el aÃ±o pasado, Veljko Paunovic.

author: afp
title: Nouvelles technologies: Â«Lâ€™intelligence artificielle nâ€™apporte aucun avantage Ã  la sociÃ©tÃ©Â»
text: Nouvelles technologiesÂ«Lâ€™intelligence artificielle nâ€™apporte aucun avantage Ã  la sociÃ©tÃ©Â» Selon la militante amÃ©ricaine Sage Lenier, les grands patrons ont Ã©tÃ© sÃ©duits par des produits Â«inutilesÂ» qui ont des consÃ©quences Â«terribles pour la planÃ¨teÂ». Les entreprises technologiques ne cessent de promouvoir des produits avec de lâ€™intelligence artificielle (IA) mais cette technologie est Â«inutileÂ», non durable, et a crÃ©Ã© Â«une crise existentielleÂ» pour le secteur, affirme la militante pour lâ€™environnement, Sage Lenier. Un discours qui dÃ©tonne au sein du Web Summit, qui rÃ©unit Ã  Lisbonne le gratin des start-up et investisseurs dans les nouvelles technologies. Â«Lâ€™IA nâ€™apporte aucun avantage Ã  la sociÃ©tÃ©Â», assÃ¨ne lâ€™AmÃ©ricaine, lors dâ€™un entretien avec lâ€™AFP en marge du sommet. Les grands patrons ont Ã©tÃ© sÃ©duits par des produits Â«inutilesÂ», abandonnant lâ€™idÃ©e que la technologie doit avoir une utilitÃ© fondamentale, et maintenant ils font face Ã  Â«une crise existentielleÂ», soutient celle qui sâ€™est fait connaÃ®tre en 2018, Ã  19 ans, lorsquâ€™elle a crÃ©Ã© un cours Ã  lâ€™universitÃ© de Berkeley (Californie), intitulÃ© Â«Solutions pour un futur juste et durableÂ», auquel des centaines dâ€™Ã©tudiants se sont inscrits. Sage Lenier a depuis fondÃ© une association sur le mÃªme thÃ¨me (Â«Sustainable & Just FutureÂ») et espÃ¨re en tirer une sÃ©rie documentaire. Â«Un gÃ¢chis dâ€™Ã©missionsÂ» Â«Certains dâ€™entre vous peuvent Ãªtre considÃ©rÃ©s comme Ã©tant les architectes, directement responsables, de la crise Ã©cologiqueÂ», avait-elle lancÃ© lâ€™an dernier aux entrepreneurs lors de son intervention au Web Summit. Elle avait plaidÃ© pour que lâ€™Ã©conomie circulaire, qui consiste Ã  mettre en avant le recyclage et le rÃ©emploi, soit au cÅ“ur de la dÃ©marche des patrons de la Â«techÂ», dont les produits finissent souvent Ã  la poubelle, alimentant le gaspillage. Appel peu entendu puisque les gÃ©ants Microsoft, Google et consorts continuent Ã  produire un flux ininterrompu de produits dopÃ©s Ã  lâ€™IA, technologie extrÃªmement Ã©nergivore, ce qui semble mettre en pÃ©ril la rÃ©alisation de leurs objectifs de neutralitÃ© carbone. Pour assurer leurs besoins croissants en Ã©lectricitÃ©, notamment ceux de leurs centres de stockage de donnÃ©es, ces mastodontes se tournent ainsi de plus en plus vers le nuclÃ©aire. Lâ€™intelligence artificielle Â«est terrible pour la planÃ¨te. Câ€™est terrible pour les populations qui vivent lÃ  oÃ¹ on implante des centres de donnÃ©es. Câ€™est juste un gÃ¢chis dâ€™Ã©missions (carbone)Â», fustige Sage Lenier. Le secteur de la Â«techÂ» est pourtant Â«la seule industrie, du moins en AmÃ©rique, qui a essayÃ© pendant des annÃ©es de se prÃ©senter comme verte, propre et pro-avenirÂ», selon lâ€™activiste. Et de rappeler que Bill Gates, cofondateur de Microsoft, Â«a Ã©crit plusieurs livres sur le changement climatiqueÂ». Futur sombre Les titans de la Â«techÂ» tiennent Ã  cette image et ont rÃ©ussi Ã  Ã©viter jusquâ€™Ã  prÃ©sent lâ€™attention et les polÃ©miques sur les questions Ã©cologiques que peuvent connaÃ®tre lâ€™industrie de la mode ou le secteur automobile, pour Sage Lenier. Â«Mais dÃ¨s quâ€™ils ont vu les opportunitÃ©s avec lâ€™IA dâ€™augmenter les profits des actionnaires, ils ont tous foncÃ©Â», dit-elle. Avec lâ€™essor de lâ€™intelligence artificielle, combinÃ©e Ã  lâ€™impact des autres industries, Sage Lenier prÃ©voit un futur sombre. Â«La situation va se dÃ©grader trÃ¨s rapidement. La chaÃ®ne alimentaire va se briser. Nous assisterons Ã  une malnutrition de masse, voire une famine de masseÂ», alerte-t-elle. Le rÃ©seau Ã©lectrique devrait aussi cÃ©der.Â» Vous ne pouvez pas avoir de voitures sur le long terme. Peu importe quâ€™elles soient Ã©lectriques ou non. Elles ne sont pas durablesÂ». Â«Nous ne pouvons pas continuer Ã  produire 80 milliards de vÃªtements par an dans un futur bas carboneÂ», poursuit la jeune femme. Tu nous suis dÃ©jÃ  sur WhatsApp? Abonne-toi Ã  notre chaÃ®ne, active la petite ğŸ”” et tu recevras un rÃ©cap de l'actu chaque jour en dÃ©but de soirÃ©e.

author: Drew Pittock
title: chevron-right
text: LAS CRUCES, New Mexico (KFOX14/CBS4) â€” New Mexico state police announced Thursday that it will be hosting its second gun buyback event in January to promote firearm safety and reduce gun violence. A slate of events across the state are scheduled for Jan. 6 from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m., with Las Cruces's happening at First Baptist Church at 4201 N. Sonoma Ranch Blvd. During the event, people can anonymously hand in unwanted guns -- functional or non-functional and no questions asked -- and receive Visa gift cards in return, with handguns worth $100 and rifles and shotguns worth $200. We are providing people a resource to turn in unwanted guns; helping law enforcement combat violent crimes where guns are used and aiding in the reduction of accidental deaths and suicides," said Troy Weisler, Chief of the New Mexico State Police. "By holding responsible voluntary gun disposal events like this, we can all help make New Mexico safer. This will be the New Mexico state police's second gun buyback, following its inaugural event in November. Although these events are "intended to prevent unwanted or unneeded guns from causing harm or being used to commit acts of violence," according to the New Mexico police, opinions about their effectiveness are mixed. RELATED: [New Mexico state police's gun buyback event in Las Cruces stirs debate over its effectiveness](https://kfoxtv.com/news/local/new-mexico-state-polices-gun-buyback-event-in-las-cruces-stirs-debate-over-its-usefulness-dennis-giever#?src=link) For example, Dennis Giever, the department head of Criminal Justice at New Mexico State University said that while some people might give their guns up, it's not going to be the people who pose the greatest threat to the community. â€œI just don't think it's really going to curb what we're trying to curb,â€ Giever told KFOX14/CBS4 in November. â€œThe guns that we need to get off the street are in the hands of people probably illegally... They sure as heck don't want to give them back." Rather, Giever suggested that law enforcement could work more closely with the community, and specifically, young people, to get their message across. â€œWe should capitalize on that as much as we can, with school-based programs," Giever said. â€œIf a kid wants to get a hold of a gun, they can get a hold of a gun. As adults, we need to be watching what our children are doing and keep them away from guns." Meanwhile, when confronted with the efficacy of such events based on past studies, Wilson Silver, a spokesperson with the New Mexico State Police Department said, "We just want to get the word out there, you know, for anyone who doesn't want the responsibility of having a firearm, this is just one option for them to, to take that firearm and turn it in.â€ RECOMMENDED: [Lt. Eric Urenda named Deputy Chief of Operations for Las Cruces Police Department](https://kfoxtv.com/news/local/lt-eric-urenda-named-deputy-chief-of-operations-for-las-cruces-police-department-jeremy-story-new-mexico#?src=link) [Sign up](/sign-up) to receive the top interesting stories from in and around our community once daily in your inbox.

title: #20 El TSJA absuelve a un condenado en CÃ³rdoba por violar a su pareja al admitir Ã©sta que lo denunciÃ³ por celos
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
#8 Cuando esta misma justicia condena a los de alsasua, o a los titiriteros, o a los 6 de Zaragoza, etc., algunos aplaudÃ­s con las orejitas. Cuando pasa esto, ya es "justicia".
Pues la LIVG la firmaron TODOS, incluido el PP...
#11 Â¿en base a que me incluyes en ese grupo? Vaya un â€œy tÃº mÃ¡sâ€ mÃ¡s patÃ©tico, que lÃ¡stima que tu mejor defensa sea inventarte lo que pienso, que ademÃ¡s de ser mentira es una bobada doble, porque ademÃ¡s de ser una burda mentira haces como si una injusticia mÃ¡s otra injusticia sumasen justicia, cuando lo que suma es doble injusticia.
Que lamentable colega, en serio.
Todo el neofeminismo gira en torno a esta idea: puesto que las mujeres tienen un miedo constante a que un hombre las viole o las maltrate, la igualdad que se busca es que todos los hombres tengan miedo tambiÃ©n a encontrarse con una loca que les denuncie y vayan a la cÃ¡rcel.
Para ello se anulan los derechos que haya que anular, presunciÃ³n de inocencia, necesidad de pruebas, etc...
De este modo se impone el criterio de una minorÃ­a de mujeres aterrorizadas sin justificaciÃ³n por los hombres que sÃ³lo quieren venganza disfrazada de una supuesta igualdad que es de todo menos eso.
Que vayan saliendo todos los mierdecillas que siempre dicen que es falso que basta la palabra de una mujer para que te comas 10 aÃ±os de trullo... No, que sigan escondidos como ratas que son, me conformo con que les pase a ellos y a su familiares.
#10 Has escogido el caso mÃ¡s desafortunado posible para decir ese comentario. El tipo fue condenado, y solo ha conseguido la absoluciÃ³n cuando ELLA HA RECONOCIDO LA DENUNCIA FALSA.
Ha sido su palabra la que le metiÃ³ en prisiÃ³n y ha sido su palabra la que le ha sacado de ahÃ­.
Hermano, date cuenta... al menos, en esta noticia, los mierdecillas esos de los que habla tienen mÃ¡s razÃ³n que tÃº
#15 no creo que sea asÃ­. Si los jueces lo condenaron fue unicamente por la palabra de la tiparraca... y esto le puede pasar a cualquiera, los jueces no tienen en cuenta mÃ¡s que eso. La confesiÃ³n posterior, que puede ocurrir o no, dependiendo de muchos factores, lo unico que hace es dejarlo mÃ¡s claro todavÃ­a. Los jueces solo tienen en cuenta la palabra de una loca, porque no pueden existir otras pruebas al ser una denuncia falsa. Si la tipa no tiene remordimiento o teme simplemente las consecuencias de haber mentido al tribunal, o el miedo a que familiares y amigos sepan la verdad ... el tio se come los 10 aÃ±itos, que es lo que estara pasando en la mayorÃ­a de los casos.

author: Reid Health
title: Reid ENT completes 50th InspireÂ® Therapy Procedure
text:
Reid ENT completes 50th InspireÂ® Therapy Procedure
Oct. 17, 2024 -- Reid ENT has completed its 50th Inspire procedure. Inspire is an FDA-approved obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) treatment option for people who cannot use Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) therapy.
Some 22 million
Americans have OSA. When left untreated, it doesn't just affect one person, but
also those around them. OSA can cause vehicle and workplace accidents,
worsening mood and memory, stroke, heart attack, and other serious issues.
CPAP is the
main treatment for OSA, but unfortunately many people don't see benefit from or
can't tolerate CPAP.
Sydney Jiang,
MD, for Reid ENT is proud to offer Inspire as another treatment option
for these patients.
"We're excited
to have completed the 50th Inspire procedure at Reid ENT and to be able to
offer this to our community," Dr. Jiang said. "Inspire represents a significant
advancement in treating sleep apnea. It's clinically proven to reduce sleep
apnea events, has a high level of patient satisfaction, and has a high therapy
adherence."
Inspire works
inside the body with a patient's natural breathing process to treat sleep
apnea. Mild stimulation opens the airway during sleep, allowing oxygen to flow
naturally. The patient uses a small handheld remote to turn Inspire on before
bed and off when they wake up.
The Inspire
system is implanted during a short, outpatient procedure. The system is placed
under the skin of the neck and chest through two small incisions. Most patients
return home the same day and take over-the-counter pain medications to manage
pain as needed. Reid completed its first Inspire system in October 2023.
Thomas Jetmore, MD, for Reid ENT recommends the device as a treatment option for patients.
"Our goal is to ensure that patients with obstructive sleep apnea receive the most effective, personalized care. Inspire therapy has transformed the lives of many by improving their sleep and overall quality of life," Dr. Jetmore said. "We're proud to offer this treatment option and are committed to making the entire processâ€”from consultation to post-procedure careâ€”as smooth and supportive as possible for our patients and their families."
Reid Health
will host a free educational webinar on Inspire at 6:30 p.m. on Nov. 13 with
the presentation led by Dr. Jiang. Register for the virtual health talk at InspireSleepEvents.com.
To learn more
about Inspire, visit reidhealth.org/inspire-sleep.

author: Sheetal
title: Contempt charges framed against DG, Health Services - The Tribune
text:
Contempt charges framed against DG, Health Services
The Punjab and Haryana High Court has framed contempt charges against Dr Manish Bansal, Director General Health Services (DGHS), Haryana, for wilful non-compliance of a prior court order relating to pay parity for Laboratory Technicians (Malaria).
Justice Harkesh Manuja observed that the State's actions amounted to deliberate defiance, manipulation of judicial proceedings, and a clear attempt to render the earlier court orders ineffective. â€œSuch selective denial to identically placed employees interferes with the course of justice,â€ the court remarked.
The contempt proceedings stem from an order dated April 30, 2024, in which the High Court had directed the State to decide the petitionersâ€™ representation in light of an earlier decision in Rajesh Kumar & Others vs State of Haryana, where similarly placed employees were granted the benefit of equal pay. That decision was upheld by the Supreme Court after dismissal of the Stateâ€™s appeal on December 17, 2024.
The contempt proceedings were initiated after petitioners Suman Verma (a differently-abled employee) and Busan Lal, both Lab Technicians in the state Health Department, were denied the benefit of a corrected pay scale â€” a benefit already extended in a similar case. The court had earlier directed the government to pass a reasoned speaking order regarding their representation, but the benefit was arbitrarily denied on procedural grounds, which the court found unacceptable.
The case stems from an anomaly dating back to 1998, when the Haryana Health Department granted a higher pay scale to promoted Lab Technicians than to those directly recruited â€” a disparity that was challenged. The court ruled in favour of the petitioners on April 18, 2022, directing the State to remove the disparity and release arrears with 9% interest.
Though the Haryana Government complied with the Rajesh Kumar judgment for those specific petitioners, it denied similar relief to Suman Verma and Busan Lal, despite identical service conditions.
Advocate Rajkumar Makkad, representing the petitioners, along with advocate Himani Makkad, stated that the Finance Department was equally responsible for contempt. Accordingly, Dr Anurag Rastogi, Additional Chief Secretary to the Haryana Government (Finance), is also being impleaded to ensure smooth enforcement of court orders.
The matter has been adjourned to April 23 for further proceedings.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Rob Lowe slams â€˜horribleâ€™ Brat Pack label: â€˜It was designed to belittle usâ€™
text:
By Sean Mandell ,
30 minutes ago
Rob Lowe has learned to live with the Brat Pack moniker despite calling it â€œhorrible.â€
The â€œ9-1-1: Lone Starâ€ actor, 60, opened up about the infamous label attributed to him and fellow actors Emilio Estevez , Demi Moore , Andrew McCarthy and Judd Nelson during the start of their careers in the 1980s, in a new interview with People .
The Brat Pack as a concept was born when New York Magazine ran a story on the young actors in June 1985. â€œHollywoodâ€™s Brat Pack,â€ the cover shouted above a photo of Lowe, Nelson and Estevez on the set of their movie â€œSt. Elmoâ€™s Fire.â€
Rob Lowe in Andrew McCarthyâ€™s â€œBRATS,â€ a documentary that explores and revisits the â€˜Brat Packâ€™ generation of his acting peers. ABC News Studios Andrew McCarthy, Ally Sheedy, Demi Moore and Jon Cryer at the World premiere of â€œBRATSâ€ as part of Tribeca Film Festival on June 7, 2024 in New York City, New York. Variety via Getty Images â€œThe article was horrible,â€ Lowe told People . â€œIt was a hit piece, thereâ€™s no doubt about it. It was designed to belittle us, make us look small, with that journalistic trick of plausible deniability.â€
Rob Lowe says threesome sex tape leak â€˜changed my life,â€™ led to him getting sober
The New York Magazine piece described the Brat Pack as being â€œto the 1980s what the Rat Pack was to the 1960s â€” a roving band of famous young stars on the prowl for parties, women and a good time.â€
Despite his disdain for the article, he said, â€œI actually came out okay in it.â€
â€œIt was the one night I went home early. What a rarity. So somebody was looking out for me,â€ he added, referring to the night he and his â€œSt. Elmoâ€™sâ€ co-stars spent with interviewer David Blum.
The New York Magazine cover story featuring the Brat Pack, from left: Rob Lowe, Judd Nelson, Emilio Estevez, June 10, 1985. Hulu/Courtesy Everett Collection He added that the Brat Pack label â€œprobably didnâ€™t help our credibility â€¦ in the industry.â€
But there was a silver lining. â€œ[T[he public â€” at the end of the day, thatâ€™s all that matters â€” never got that memo,â€ Lowe said regarding the intended derision the title originally held. â€œTheyâ€™re like, â€˜That sounds cool.'â€
â€œI think I realized that probably quicker than the rest of the [group of actors], that it was a good thing.â€
Rob Lowe: â€˜Nepo babyâ€™ is the new â€˜Brat Packâ€™: â€˜Iâ€™ve been there for both of themâ€™
Andrew McCarthy, Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Rob Lowe in 1985â€™s â€œSt. Elmoâ€™s Fire.â€ Â©Columbia Pictures/Courtesy Everett Collection ST. ELMOâ€™S FIRE, Demi Moore, Rob Lowe, 1985. Â©Columbia Pictures/Courtesy Everett Collection â€œThe Brat Pack is having a moment,â€ he added, noting that McCarthyâ€™s documentary about the group â€“ â€œBRATSâ€ â€“ â€œhas a lot to do with it.â€
â€œAnd it couldnâ€™t make me happier,â€ he said. â€œIt was a seminal point for me becoming comfortable in the space I occupied as an actor, for lack of a better term, and the beginning of a real rocket-ship ride.â€
Talking with McCarthy in â€œBRATS,â€ Lowe reflected on his relationship to the infamous moniker. â€œThereâ€™s always going to be some perception that bumps up against how you see yourself,â€ he explained.
BRATS, US poster, from left: Judd Nelson, Ally Sheedy, Rob Lowe, Mare Winningham (obscured), Emilio Estevez, Andrew McCarthy, Demi Moore, 2024. Hulu/Courtesy Everett Collection CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP FOR OUR MORNING REPORT NEWSLETTER
Rob Lowe in his â€œBrat Packâ€ heyday. WireImage â€œNo one liked [the Brat Pack label],â€ he said. â€œI donâ€™t want to come off seeming like Iâ€™m so Pollyanna that I donâ€™t realize or didnâ€™t know at the time what a fâ€“king disaster and how mean spirited and what an attempt that was to minimize our talents.â€
He added that today, â€œIt pains me when I see folks who donâ€™t see how much love is infused into the Brat Pack. Itâ€™s nothing but goodwill.â€
Andrew McCarthy explores and revisits the Brat Pack generation of his acting peers in â€œBRATS.â€ ABC News Studios Emilio Estevez, Demi Moore, Rob Lowe and Melissa Gilbert. Ron Galella Collection via Getty Images Asked by McCarthy if the branding will follow him and his â€™80s cohort â€œto the end,â€ Lowe responded, â€œIt will, for sure.â€ He went one step further, adding, â€œit should.â€
â€œWe were so lucky to be in the right place at the right time as the movie business was beginning the transition to where it landed and still exists â€” which is movies made almost exclusively for 18- to 20-year-olds,â€ he shared.
â€œEvery summer movie thatâ€™s out is geared towards that audience. It wasnâ€™t always like that. We were there at that time that it began.â€
Reflecting on the impact of the Brat Pack creation, he added, â€œIt changed all of our livesâ€¦ it changed what entertainment is.â€
For the latest in entertainment, top headlines, breaking news and more, visit nypost.com/entertainment/
